column4: I still get a Look Up timeout on Wikipedia.org in Firefox despite having disabled IPv6 as per the wiki article and having set the about:config value in Firefox appropriately. Dig and Network Tools Lookup still works.
Also, does anybody know a way to monitor the system fans and system/cpu temperature in Linux? I don't want to have to reboot whenever I suspect that they might be acting up.
like i have asked some time ago, did you checked your dns configuration ?
You did? Sorry. Where do I check my dns config?
doesn't your BIOS takes care of that ? Shuting dow if required ?
/etc/resolv.conf
i dont use it, but there is something called lm sensors
on a terminal, type sudo apt-cache search fan sensors
your name service is coming from the router, did you checked the configuration on windows ?
if on windows evertyhing is fine, eventually windows is using the internet dns servers

There are multiple windows computers on the network, on all of them wikipedia.org can be resolved correctly. The only PC acting up is my linux box, on which most domains work fine, except for wikipedia.org, which doesn't make sense.
on the windows box, open a command prompt
Also, as I said, the DNS server is set to the same, i.e. the router.
and tupe ipconfig /all
check for the dns server IPs
so, so it's not dns, its a networking issue
Same result
ok, i am out of ideas, that seems to be a networking issue
if firefox hangs during "Lookup" it is doing a lookup...
have you tried with other browser ?
gnome-app-install
ta
